alert.note: Alert for Mohave (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 31 at 9:41PM MST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 AM MST MONDAY... * WHAT...Extensive flooding caused by excessive rainfall within Golden Valley is expected to continue down the Sacramento Wash overnight. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Arizona, including the following county, Mohave. * WHEN...Until 445 AM MST Monday. * IMPACTS...Automated gauges along the Sacramento Wash indicate 1 to 3 feet of water continuing to move downstream through the Sacramento Wash. Water will continue toward Topock overnight. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Low-water crossings have been inundated with water and may not be passable. It will take several hours for all the water to work through all the washes that drain into the Sacramento Wash. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 933 PM MST, Automated gauges along the Sacramento Wash indicate 1 to 3 feet of water continuing to move downstream through the Sacramento Wash. Flooding will continue overnight. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sacramento Wash from Golden Valley to Topock. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
